definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Never have family or friends give quotes to the press. Handle your own business.
sentences.chinese: 不要让你的亲人或朋友给小道消息给媒体。

sentences.english: " And he said, "Oh, I heard it on the grapevine.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“我打听来的小道消息。”

sentences.english: A piece of juicy gossip is going the rounds.
sentences.chinese: 一条绘声绘色的小道消息正在传来传去。

sentences.english: Don't believe anything through the grapevine. There are more and more gossipers.
sentences.chinese: 不要听任何小道消息，此刻传闲话的人越来越多了。

sentences.english: I heard the story through the grapevine.
sentences.chinese: 那个故事我是从小道消息听到的。

sentences.english: Hey, old buddy, I heard it through the grapevine that you are getting married. Can that be true?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，老伙计，我听小道消息说你要结婚了，是真的吗？

sentences.english: All this scuttle butt was laughed off as nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 这些小道消息被当作一派胡言而一笑置之。

sentences.english: There are rumors around the country that another big round of write-offs is imminent.
sentences.chinese: 据小道消息说，另一个巨大的呆账循环更是无止境。

sentences.english: I heard it through the grapevine.
These hearsay are treated as nonsense and push it away with a smile.
sentences.chinese: 这些小道消息被当作一派胡言而一笑置之。

pinyin: xiao1 xi5 ling2 tong1 ren2 shi4

definition: lit. chasing the wind and clutching at shadows (idiom); fig. groundless accusations/to act on hearsay evidence
lit. without wind there cannot be waves (idiom); there must be a reason/no smoke without fire
to spread falsehoods/to increasingly distort the truth/to pile errors on top of errors (idiom)
